data.title: Game crash on startup!
data.body:
Hello,

I am using _Ubuntu 15.10_ on an ivybridge intel laptop. when starting the game fresh. Once the main screen loads, I attempt to adjust the system volume via volume key(f10) and the "fn" function button. I will see the volume bar graphic reduce volume and it locks up the game. Other system processes seem fine. I recreated this issue 3 times before submitting.

Hope its nothing, or at least an easy fix!

data.title: Added D2k 7000 start cash option
data.body:
Added the 7k cash option from the original game (it was the max amount).

Could do a 14k / 15k option too but I don't know if there's much point.

data.title: Suggestion rank up engineers after captureing something?
data.body: I thought about that Engineers can't kill other units. So mayebe he gets promotions another way like captured some buildings. I didn't think about the other "not shooting units" like medics, mechanics, hijackers,... dogs :D

data.title: Switch WithSpriteRotorOverlay to WithRotorSpriteOverlay
data.body:
In accordance with other render traits and suggestion in #9541.

Note: While not strictly necessary for this release, it would spare modders from another rename with Next+1 if this went into prep-1512.

data.title: Change engineVersion for several upgrade rules to 20150920
data.body:
Those changes were merged after the feature-freeze on 20150808, but predate the last stable release (20150919). Changing the engine version to the day after release makes it easier for modders to upgrade without using fake engine dates.

Also fixes upgrade rule for WithRotor rename to account for @ separator.

Closes #9894.

data.title: Infantry rapidly change animations attack moving across blocked bridge
data.body:
Not sure if this has been reported, but if you block a bridge one cell wide with a vehicle and then order stationary infantry to attack move across the bridge (and no other routes exist) they will remain where they should but they rapidly change between animations until the bridge is clear and they can move.

Most notable on the cnc dino mission with rocket soldiers. On bleed.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28028790-infantry-rapidly-change-animations-attack-moving-across-blocked-bridge?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: The TS legacy tileset importer utility command throws out RGB colors.
data.body: It wasn't updated as part of the RGB-to-hex PR. I'm kinda busy in the weekend so sorry for reporting it and not fixing it. >_>

data.title: Added the possibility to zoom the map
data.body:
Alt Key + Mouse Wheel to Zoom
All zoom levels are available in the Editor
In regular games only zooming in is allowed, the other zoom levels are
unlocked when the game is finished

data.title: Limit airstrike on cnc64gdi01.
data.body:
Remove airstrike support power from comms centre to match removal of ION cannon.

Resolves #9903.

EDIT: Actually looking at #9118 there seem to be varying views on the airstrike. Again, I'll let everyone discuss.

data.title: Map editor tooltips rework

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
Makes the actor tooltips in the map editors look like the in game version with extra information lines for manual editing. This should be friendlier to map authors who do not go into the MiniYaml or Lua.

Closes #9883 but if a smaller temporary 2 line tooltip fix is preferred, I can do that (in another PR dropping "PR: For stable" and Next from this PR).

data.title: cnc64gdi01 air-strike support power
data.body:
ION cannon has been disabled (probably to eliminate the easy one shot kill on the bio lab objective) but the air-strike support power is granted upon building a comms centre which is still a one shot kill on the bio lab. 

Might be same in the original but the oRA balance of the air strike makes this mission easy to complete with a couple orcas and a comms centre.

data.title: engineVersion pseudo-dates
data.body:
Since #9894 is caused by `engineVersion` having reasonably close to merge dates that fell between playtest and release, I propose using pseudo-dates where the estimated month for the target playtest/release is used for pull requests. Scripts would update these in `OpenRA.Mods.Common/UtilityCommands/UpgradeRules.cs` when publishing a playtest or release

Ex:
    \* 20151201 -> "PR: For stable"
    \* 20160301 -> Next + 1
    \* ---
    \* playtest on say 20160224
    \* replace `engineVersion < 20160301` with `engineVersion < 20160224` in `OpenRA.Mods.Common/UtilityCommands/UpgradeRules.cs`

Pull request could be merged without changing `engineVersion` even if there is a playtest in between.

The `bleed` probably should also be updated to keep `engineVersion` for the upgrade rules in sync.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28009419-engineversion-pseudo-dates?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: D2k crate balance
data.body:
- Fixed prerequisites.
- Added more infantry crates, because they were lacking and it's cool to find IMO.
- Upped the crate explosion damage, though it is still very little really. Takes about a third health off a Trike.

data.title: "PR: Needs Fixup" label for minor changes that don't invalidate "PR: Needs +2"
data.body:
"PR: Needs Fixup" label would be applied after "PR: Needs +2" when a reviewer would like to merge the pull request but a test commit needs to be removed or some other relatively minor changes should or need to be made first.

The label should be orange like "PR: Rebase me!" since it is also a simple rewrite label.

data.body:
This would help catch issues like #9895.

data.title: D2K unit crate definitions have bogus prerequisites
data.body: This means that they never show up in the game.

data.title: RenderBuilding and Targetable upgrade rules have the wrong dates
data.body:
From http://ppmforums.com/viewtopic.php?p=537686

>  Doing an upgrade from 20150919 resulted in Targetable stuff not being fixed (because the code reads if (engineVersion < 20150902) to change that stuff). Had to fool the upgrader by telling it the engine version was 20150901 
> 
>  I also had to do RenderBuilding related traits manually. 

Both of these changes have engine dates < 20150919 but weren't shipped in the 20150919 release.

- Use the correct deploy sound for the mcv

data.title: RA, Soviet 04a mission, radar dome reinforcements
data.body:
I tried asking this in IRC, but got no response - so here it is:

(playtest 20151031)
When I was playing the single player mission (RA, soviet 04a) the briefing states that killing the enemy radar dome would cut of their reinforcements. It didn't _seem_ to be true.

Can you please check the mission scripting?
Thanks.
